Taiwan urges China not to change 'status quo' around waters near Kinmen islandsTaiwan's Mainland Affairs Council on Friday urged China not to change the "status quo" around waters near Taiwan-controlled Kinmen islands by sending coast guard boats into restricted areas. Fri, 08 Mar 2024 08:34:48 GMT 6WCOYZRHSJLPRM3ZG5ECAIYLLI https://www.reuters.com/world/taiwan-urges-china-not-change-status-quo-around-waters-near-kinmen-islands-2024-03-08/Reuters世界
Takeover target Currys says Greek disposal will complete in AprilCurrys , the British electricals retailer at the centre of a potential takeover battle, said on Friday a deal to sell its Greek unit would complete in the first half of April after it was given the go-ahead by authorities there. More Indian troops at border won't ease tensions, says China foreign ministryChina believes that India's move to add more troops at a disputed border with India is "not conducive to easing tensions", a spokesperson for the Chinese foreign ministry said on Friday at a regular news briefing. Article 23: what you need to know about Hong Kong's new national security lawsHong Kong's government on Friday unveiled its proposed national security bill, following a month-long public consultation that ended last week. City leaders want it to be swiftly passed, potentially within weeks. Asian stocks draw massive foreign funds on China's reforms, AI surgeForeign investors poured substantial money into Asian equities in February amid a rebound in Chinese stocks following Beijing's rollout of reform measures and a surge in technology shares, driven by the artificial intelligence (AI) boom.
